blog.title: Blog
blog.pageTitle: Why Gas Piston Units Are the Best Choice for Your Business?

data.title: Why Gas Piston Units Are the Best Choice for Your Business?
data.details: Gas piston units (GPUs) offer a reliable and efficient solution for businesses seeking energy independence. They provide electricity and heat simultaneously, reducing dependency on external grids and lowering operational costs. With high efficiency and flexibility, GPUs are ideal for various industries, from agriculture to manufacturing, ensuring uninterrupted operations and significant savings.
data.description: Agricultural enterprises generate significant amounts of organic waste (manure, crop residues, processing waste), which can be converted into biogas through anaerobic digestion. These sectors require electricity for equipment, heat for heating premises or greenhouses, and hot water for technological processes. Cogeneration systems ensure energy efficiency, reducing costs and promoting sustainable development. For example, dairy farms can use heat for milk pasteurization, while crop farms can use CO₂ to boost yields. Using biogas from waste enables energy independence, which is especially critical for remote rural areas.
data.subtitle: Up to 50% savings on electricity – reduced tariffs, no transmission or distribution fees...

data.title: How to Choose the Right Gas Piston Unit
data.details: Selecting the right gas piston unit (GPU) involves evaluating power needs, fuel availability, and operational requirements. Consider factors like efficiency, maintenance costs, and compatibility with existing infrastructure. GPUs offer flexibility with natural gas or biogas, making them suitable for diverse applications, from industrial plants to greenhouses, ensuring cost savings and reliability.
data.description: Agricultural enterprises generate significant amounts of organic waste (manure, crop residues, processing waste), which can be converted into biogas through anaerobic digestion. These sectors require electricity for equipment, heat for heating premises or greenhouses, and hot water for technological processes. Cogeneration systems ensure energy efficiency, reducing costs and promoting sustainable development. For example, dairy farms can use heat for milk pasteurization, while crop farms can use CO₂ to boost yields. Using biogas from waste enables energy independence, which is especially critical for remote rural areas.
data.subtitle: An efficient solution for autonomous energy supply, reducing costs...

data.title: Service Life of Generators by Brand
data.details: The service life of gas piston generators varies by brand, maintenance practices, and operating conditions. High-quality brands can operate for over 10 years with proper care. Regular maintenance, such as oil changes and component checks, extends lifespan and ensures reliable performance for critical applications.
data.description: Regular maintenance is critical for maximizing the lifespan of gas piston units. Key maintenance tasks include timely oil changes, inspection of engine components, and monitoring exhaust systems to ensure compliance with environmental standards. Proper care ensures consistent performance and minimizes downtime.
data.subtitle: Main types of maintenance for gas piston units...

data.title: Distributed Generation Strategy in Ukraine
data.details: Distributed generation is gaining traction in Ukraine, enabling businesses and communities to produce energy locally. This approach reduces reliance on centralized grids, enhances energy security, and promotes sustainability through the use of gas piston units and renewable sources like biogas and solar.
data.description: Ukraine is rapidly developing a distributed generation program, which involves installing gas piston units and renewable energy systems. This strategy enhances energy independence, reduces transmission losses, and supports economic growth by providing reliable power to businesses and public institutions.
data.subtitle: Ukraine is rapidly advancing its distributed generation program...

for_cooperation.title: Cooperation Options in the Public Sector:
for_cooperation.subtitle: For the public sector, critical infrastructure, and municipal facilities, we offer flexible cooperation models:

list.title: Direct Electricity Sales to Consumers:
list.subtitle: After commissioning solar or gas piston power plants, a one-year direct electricity supply contract is signed with automatic renewal, ensuring electricity prices are lower than those of the supplier.

list.title: ESCO Contract:
list.subtitle: Payment for electricity over 10-15 years based on the formula: P_ee = 0.9 × P, where P is the total electricity cost, including distribution and transmission tariffs. After the contract term, the solar power plant is transferred to the consumer’s balance.

industries.name: Agriculture and Livestock
industries.description: Processing organic waste (manure, crop residues, processing waste) into biogas through anaerobic digestion.

tips: Agricultural complexes for crop cultivation (corn, wheat, etc.)
paragraph: Agricultural enterprises generate significant amounts of organic waste (manure, crop residues, processing waste), which can be converted into biogas through anaerobic digestion. These sectors require electricity for equipment, heat for heating premises or greenhouses, and hot water for technological processes.

Cogeneration systems ensure energy efficiency, reducing costs and promoting sustainable development. For example, dairy farms can use heat for milk pasteurization, while crop farms can use CO₂ to boost yields. Using biogas from waste enables energy independence, which is especially critical for remote rural areas.

perks.title: Energy Independence:
perks.text: Reduces reliance on external grids, critical for remote farms.

perks.title: Environmental Sustainability:
perks.text: Converting waste into biogas reduces methane emissions and supports a circular economy.

perks.title: Increased Yields:
perks.text: CO₂ from exhaust gases stimulates plant growth in greenhouses or crop farms.

perks.title: Savings:
perks.text: Up to 50% reduction in energy costs through efficient use of biogas or natural gas.

perks.title: Additional Income:
perks.text: Excess electricity can be sold to the grid, and digestate can be used as fertilizer.

principle: The gas piston engine runs on natural gas or biogas from organic waste.

The engine generates electricity for equipment, and heat from cooling and exhaust gases is used for heating or hot water. In trigeneration systems, heat is converted into cooling for refrigeration units. CO₂ from exhaust gases is purified and used to fertilize plants, increasing yields in greenhouses or garden centers.

industries.name: Greenhouse Farming

headers.principle: Why Cogeneration is Important for Greenhouses

industries.description: Cogeneration and gas piston units (CHPs and GPPs) provide energy and optimal conditions for plant growth.

paragraph: Cogeneration and gas piston units (CHPs and GPPs) open new opportunities for greenhouse farming, providing not only energy but also optimal conditions for plant growth.
These systems simultaneously produce electricity, heat, and CO₂, increasing yields and reducing costs.

perks.title: Year-round Efficiency:
perks.text: Heat storage systems maintain optimal greenhouse conditions regardless of external temperatures, ensuring stable plant growth even in winter.

perks.title: Reliability and Safety:
perks.text: Modern control systems ensure stable operation and safety. Integrated sensors monitor lighting, temperature, and emissions, creating optimal conditions for plants and staff.

perks.title: Energy Autonomy:
perks.text: Cogeneration frees greenhouse complexes from reliance on regional grids and rising tariffs. Compact unit placement eliminates the need for expensive transmission networks, and power regulation ensures flexibility.

perks.title: Reduced Energy Costs:
perks.text: Cogeneration units save 40–60% on electricity and heat compared to external grid supply. Investments typically pay off in 2–4 years, depending on scale and operating conditions.

perks.title: Environmental Sustainability:
perks.text: Low-emission combustion technologies (DLE) and exhaust treatment reduce harmful emissions. Using biogas from organic waste further reduces the carbon footprint and supports sustainability.

perks.title: High Efficiency:
perks.text: Total fuel utilization efficiency reaches 90%: electricity is generated with up to 47% efficiency, and combined with heat, up to 90%. Systems start quickly (2–3 minutes), enabling rapid response to farm needs.

perks.title: Additional Income:
perks.text: Excess electricity can be sold to the grid, creating an additional revenue stream for greenhouse farms.

principle: Plants in greenhouses actively absorb CO₂ during photosynthesis, especially under intensive artificial lighting. Increasing CO₂ levels in the greenhouse atmosphere (to 700–1000 ppm) can boost yields by 20–30%, particularly for tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, or ornamental plants.
Cogeneration units provide stable CO₂, heat, and electricity supply, creating ideal conditions for year-round production.
solution: Genexpert offers innovative cogeneration and gas piston units that provide greenhouse complexes with electricity, heat, and CO₂ to increase yields. Our solutions are tailored to individual farm needs, operating on natural gas or biogas.
We guarantee high efficiency, resource savings, and compliance with environmental standards, helping you achieve maximum productivity and cost reduction.

how_it_works.title: Cogeneration is a technology for combined electricity and heat production, ideal for greenhouse complexes. The system is based on gas piston engines running on natural gas or biogas.
how_it_works.subtitle: Here’s how it works step by step:
how_it_works.description: This comprehensive approach allows greenhouse farms to obtain three key resources—electricity, heat, and CO₂—from a single source, significantly improving efficiency.

tips.title: Energy Production
tips.subtitle: The gas piston engine burns fuel to generate electricity for lighting, ventilation, or pumps in greenhouses, ensuring stable equipment operation even during peak loads.

tips.title: Heat Utilization
tips.subtitle: Heat generated during engine operation is captured through heat exchangers and used to heat greenhouses, maintain optimal plant temperatures, or heat water for technological needs.

tips.title: CO₂ Enrichment
tips.subtitle: Engine exhaust gases contain CO₂, vital for photosynthesis. After purification through selective catalytic reduction (SCR) and oxidation systems, gases are cooled to a safe temperature (around 50°C) and supplied to greenhouses. Each cubic meter of burned natural gas produces up to 1.8 kg of CO₂, promoting faster plant growth.

tips.title: Control and Safety
tips.subtitle: Special monitoring systems continuously check exhaust gas composition to ensure safety for plants and compliance with environmental standards, guaranteeing clean CO₂ supply.

industries.name: Food Industry
industries.description: An energy-intensive sector requiring electricity for equipment, heat for pasteurization, cooking, or drying, and cooling for product storage.

tips: Meat processing plants, sausage factories, canning plants
Beverage production (breweries, distilleries, juices, mineral water)
Dairy product manufacturing (yogurt, butter, powdered milk)
paragraph: The food industry is energy-intensive, requiring electricity for equipment, heat for pasteurization, cooking, or drying, and cooling for product storage.

Cogeneration and trigeneration systems provide all these energy types from a single source, reducing costs and increasing efficiency. Biogas from waste (e.g., from brewing or meat processing) can serve as an additional fuel source. For example, breweries use steam for brewing, while dairy plants use heat for pasteurization and cooling for storage, ensuring product quality and safety.

perks.title: Savings:
perks.text: Up to 50% reduction in energy costs thanks to up to 95% efficiency.

perks.title: Environmental Sustainability:
perks.text: Using biogas reduces CO₂ emissions.

perks.title: Flexibility:
perks.text: Provides steam, hot water, cooling, or humidity control for various processes.

perks.title: Reliability:
perks.text: Uninterrupted energy supply to maintain product quality.

principle: The gas piston engine runs on natural gas or biogas, generating electricity for equipment. Heat from the engine is used to produce steam, hot water, or superheated water for pasteurization, washing, or drying. In trigeneration systems, heat is converted into cooling via absorption chillers for storage or air conditioning.
These systems ensure high efficiency and versatility for the food industry’s needs.

industries.name: Waste Processing
industries.description: Producing biogas from organic waste, sewage sludge, or food industry waste (e.g., distillery byproducts).

paragraph: Waste processing enterprises produce biogas from organic waste, sewage sludge, or food industry waste (e.g., distillery byproducts). This biogas fuels gas piston engines, turning waste into a valuable energy resource.

Cogeneration systems reduce disposal and emission costs, providing electricity and heat for internal needs. For example, wastewater treatment plants can use biogas for aeration and digester heating, improving efficiency.
These systems also help meet environmental regulations by reducing methane emissions.

perks.title: Waste Conversion:
perks.text: Biogas from waste is converted into electricity and heat.

perks.title: Environmental Sustainability:
perks.text: Reduces methane and CO₂ emissions, meeting regulations.

perks.title: Savings:
perks.text: Reduces energy and waste disposal costs.

perks.title: Income:
perks.text: Excess electricity can be sold to the grid.

principle: Biogas, obtained through anaerobic digestion, is burned in a gas piston engine to produce electricity. Heat from the engine is used for heating or drying.
Exhaust treatment systems (DeNOx SCR, regenerative thermal oxidizers) ensure environmental compliance. This approach transforms waste processing into a sustainable energy source.

industries.name: Industrial Production
industries.description: High energy consumption for smelting, drying, or steam production.

paragraph: Industrial enterprises have high energy consumption for smelting, drying, or steam production.

Cogeneration systems provide stable electricity and heat supply, reducing costs and increasing efficiency. For example, pulp and paper factories use steam for paper drying, while metallurgical plants use heat for smelting. These systems can operate in remote locations, ensuring uninterrupted production. Modern exhaust treatment technologies make them suitable for industries with strict environmental requirements.

perks.title: Efficiency:
perks.text: Up to 95% total efficiency through combined production.

perks.title: Savings:
perks.text: Reduced energy costs and downtime avoidance.

perks.title: Reliability:
perks.text: Uninterrupted energy supply for continuous production.

perks.title: Environmental Sustainability:
perks.text: Reduced emissions through efficient fuel use and treatment systems (RTO, SCR).

principle: The gas piston engine burns natural gas, producing electricity and heat for industrial processes like steam production or drying. In trigeneration systems, heat is converted into cooling for air conditioning or equipment cooling.
The systems adapt to specific needs, such as high-temperature heat for ceramics or diathermic oil for plastics.

industries.name: Chemical and Pharmaceutical Industry
industries.description: Require electricity, steam, and cooling for chemical reactions, drug production, or raw material processing.

paragraph: These industries require significant amounts of electricity, steam, and cooling for chemical reactions, drug production, or raw material processing.

Cogeneration systems provide reliable and efficient energy supply, reducing costs and meeting strict environmental standards. For example, pharmaceutical enterprises use steam for sterilization, while chemical plants use heat for distillation. Using biogas or low-carbon fuels supports sustainability.

perks.text: Up to 50% reduction in energy costs through high efficiency.

perks.title: Reliability:
perks.text: Uninterrupted supply for sensitive processes.

perks.text: Reduced CO₂ and NOx emissions through treatment systems.

principle: The gas piston engine generates electricity, and heat is used to produce steam or hot water for chemical reactions or sterilization. In trigeneration systems, heat is converted into cooling for air conditioning or cooling processes.
Exhaust treatment systems (SCR reactors) ensure compliance with environmental regulations.

industries.name: Data Centers
industries.description: Consume significant electricity for servers and cooling, requiring high reliability.

paragraph: Data centers consume vast amounts of electricity for servers and cooling, requiring high reliability.
Cogeneration and trigeneration systems provide stable electricity and cooling supply, reducing costs and emissions.
These systems can operate in island mode during grid outages, ensuring operational continuity. For example, large cloud computing centers use trigeneration for server room cooling.

principle: The gas piston engine produces electricity for servers, and heat is converted into cooling via absorption chillers for room cooling.
The system can operate in parallel with the grid or autonomously, ensuring reliability. Modern control systems optimize energy production based on data center needs.

paragraph: Logistics and commercial facilities require stable electricity for lighting, equipment, heating, and cooling.

Cogeneration systems provide energy efficiency, reliability, and cost reduction, critical for commercial operations. For example, shopping centers use cooling for air conditioning, and warehouses use heat for product storage.
These systems also increase property value through environmental certifications like LEED.

industries.description: Requires flexible, scalable, and efficient energy solutions for large or remote facilities.

paragraph: Energy infrastructure requires flexible, scalable, and efficient energy solutions for large or remote facilities. Cogeneration systems provide electricity and heat for industrial parks, district heating, or microgrids, while biogas enterprises use organic waste as fuel. Peak load stations respond quickly to grid needs, and compressed/liquefied gas ensures fuel supply in remote areas. These systems support the transition to low-carbon energy.

Peak load stations provide quick startup (2–4 minutes) for grid balancing. Compressed or liquefied gas ensures fuel supply in remote areas.

industries.name: Public Institutions, Municipal Facilities, and Critical Infrastructure
industries.description: Require stable and cost-effective energy supply.

tips: Public institutions (administrative centers, ministries, courts, archives)
Municipal facilities (water treatment plants, hospitals, schools, kindergartens, heating stations)
Critical infrastructure (emergency services, communication hubs, water utilities, boiler plants, electrical substations)
paragraph: Public institutions and municipal facilities require stable and cost-effective energy supply to ensure uninterrupted public services, such as administrative management, education, or healthcare. Critical infrastructure, including emergency services and water utilities, demands reliable power to maintain safety and societal functions.

Cogeneration and trigeneration systems provide electricity, heat, and cooling, optimizing costs and ensuring operational continuity even during grid outages. For example, water treatment plants can use biogas from sewage sludge for energy production, and hospitals use heat for heating or sterilization.

These systems support sustainable development goals, reducing reliance on fossil fuels and emissions. Implementing cogeneration also modernizes outdated municipal infrastructure, enhancing efficiency and resilience to emergencies.

perks.title: Reliability:
perks.text: Uninterrupted energy supply for critical facilities, ensuring stable operation in any conditions.

perks.title: Environmental Sustainability:
perks.text: Using biogas and efficient systems reduces CO₂ emissions, meeting national environmental standards.

perks.title: Resilience:
perks.text: Island mode operation during emergency grid outages enhances critical infrastructure reserves.

perks.title: Savings:
perks.text: Up to 40% reduction in energy costs for public institutions, allowing funds to be allocated to social needs.

perks.title: Flexibility:
perks.text: Provides electricity, heat, and cooling for diverse needs, from heating schools to cooling communication hub server rooms.

principle: The gas piston engine runs on natural gas or biogas, generating electricity for lighting, equipment, communication systems, or water utility pumps. Heat from the engine and exhaust gases is used for heating administrative buildings, schools, hospitals, or for technological processes like water heating in treatment plants. In trigeneration systems, heat is converted into cooling via absorption chillers for air conditioning or equipment cooling, such as in communication hubs.

The systems are equipped with backup capabilities and can operate autonomously, ensuring critical infrastructure resilience during grid outages. Modern exhaust treatment systems (e.g., SCR reactors) ensure compliance with environmental regulations.

cooperation.title: Cooperation
cooperation.subtitle: Sectors of Cooperation
cooperation.description: We offer comprehensive energy solutions for various industries, ensuring efficiency, reliability, and sustainability through gas piston and cogeneration systems.

public.title: Public Sector
public.subtitle: We provide tailored energy solutions for public institutions and critical infrastructure, ensuring reliable and cost-effective power supply. Our systems support municipalities, hospitals, and schools with electricity, heat, and cooling, reducing costs and enhancing sustainability.

private.title: Private Sector
private.subtitle: Our solutions empower businesses with energy independence, reducing operational costs and ensuring uninterrupted operations. From agriculture to manufacturing, our gas piston and cogeneration systems deliver efficient and reliable energy tailored to your needs.

contact_form.title: Cut Costs! We’ll Handle Everything Turnkey
contact_form.subtitle: A reliable partner in transitioning to your own generation. Reduce energy costs by up to 50% and ensure stable business operations.
